answers.answer: Thats on the bigger side. But definitely not too big.
I had two 8lb babies they were perfect. I would recommend tho buying 0-3 months clothes. Won't need much newborn
My 1st was 8lbs. He only wore newborn clothes for a week because he was bigger and grew so fast. My sister in law had a 9lb baby right after me so mine seemed small.
U think itd inheritage? Me or his dad is big we both were like 6 pounds at birth
I think it can be but the baby's weight will depend on other stuff like diabetes.
My 1st was 8.8lbs n second 7, me n my partner were both big babies. He was 11lbs and me 10lbs so idont think ita to do much with inheritance. I'd look at it as a nice sized bubba :) GoodLuck!
Im not diabetic im healthy.. Lol... Just wondering.. This lady was like u eating to much has nothing to do with the baby gaining weight.. Im like what? Lol
My son was 9lb 5oz when he was born
I was 5lbs 12 oz when I was born but apparently that's considered small.
My understanding is that 7 lbs is the average weight for a baby,  so 8lb isn't big at all
Where doea babies get their weight from at birth? I know they eat what we eat but what else what causes them to gain the most weight?

Food intake.  If you have a good strong umbilical chord with lots of capacity to deliver food and oxygen,  and you get a lot of calories,  your baby will be bigger than babies that have smaller placentas and the mother eats less.Birth length (length of the baby at full term birth) is a better indicator of genetics and correlates with the size the baby will be in adulthood.  So a long baby will usually grow into a tall adult.  But a heavy baby with a normal length is just a heavy baby,  due to mother eating a lot of calories and a good placenta.

That's why mothers who smoke tend to have smaller babies than mothers who don't smoke.  The moms who smoke have smaller blood vessels (thus,  smaller umbilical cord) and the baby gets less nutrition during pregnancy.

question: Do you guys think 8 pounds is a big baby?
title: is this 2 big?
